sim.author: Curt Olson - Syd Adams - Ludovic Brenta - chris_blues - Sascha Rei√üner

help.title: Cessna 550 Citation-II
help.line: Many features require power to operate. Make sure at least battery is switched on!
help.text:
Ground Proximity Warning System: Use circuit breaker 'GROUND PROX' in 'AVIONICS DC' on right circuit breaker panel to switch off warnings.
Autopilot (AP) operation: Autopilot will disengage below decision height or 500ft above ground, whichever is highest. AP: engage and disengage the autopilot YD: engage and disengage the yaw damper LOW BANK: set half turnrate (4min for a 360) SOFT RIDE: slowing the control output PITCH wheel: without FD adjust pitch FD in pitch mode adjust pitch FD in VS mode adjust vertical speed TURN knob: turn the aircraft, kicks FD off! (must be neutral to engage the AP and/or the FD)
Flight Director (FD) operation: FD OFF: engage and disengage the FD HDG: heading mode (follow heading bug) NAV: NAV mode (capture and follow radial) APR: approach mode (capture and follow localizer and glideslope) BC: back course (capture and follow localizer backward) NAV/HSI: toggle the navigation source between NAV1 and NAV2 ALT: altitude (hold current altitude) ALT SEL: altitude select (capture the selected altitude and hold it) VNAV: vertical navigation (maintain vertical path acording to the VNCC) VS: vertical speed (can be set by the pitch wheel on AP panel) IAS: control pitch to hold current indicated airspeed
Vertical Navigation Computer/Controller [VNCC] operation: ALT: selected altitude [in 100 of FT] (for ALT SEL) STAEL: station elevation [in 100 of FT] (for VNAV) TO: distance [in NM] to the station (for VNAV) FR: distance [in NM] from the station (for VNAV) VANG: calculated angle [in deg] to the station (for VNAV)
---------------------------------------------------
To fold / unfold the passenger's tables, left or middle click respectively, holding the button down as long as necessary to fold the elements. To stow and unstow the folded table, left or middle-click on the cupholders.
